alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Henderson; McDonough; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 5:24PM CDT until March 31 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Hancock County in west central Illinois... Henderson County in west central Illinois... West central Warren County in west central Illinois... Western McDonough County in west central Illinois... Southeastern Henry County in southeastern Iowa... Southern Des Moines County in southeastern Iowa... Lee County in southeastern Iowa... Eastern Clark County in northeastern Missouri... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 523 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Pilot Grove to near Winchester, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... West Point, St. Paul, Lowell, Pilot Grove and Stephenson Park around 530 PM CDT. Denmark, Geode State Park and Camp L-Kee-Ta around 535 PM CDT. Hamilton, Danville, Middletown, Iowa Army Ammunition Plant, Camp Eastman, Sandusky and Galland around 540 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include West Burlington, Elvaston, Beaverdale, Des Moines County Fairgrounds, Burlington, Starr`s Cave Park and Preserve, Carthage, Ferris, Adrian, Colusa, Gladstone, Burnside, Disco, Fountain Green and Webster. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Illinois...southeastern Iowa...and northeastern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for west central Illinois...southeastern Iowa...and northeastern Missouri.
